page.title: 03Barnby in the W. Amenities
page.content: The village has a church, a post office, a pub and a public telephone (many houses have their own phone). There is no longer a village shop or school. When the latter closed it was taken over by the Parish Council as a village hall. Each week a fishmonger, a grocer and a greengrocer visit the village. Milk, newspapers and mail are delivered daily and a library van visits every fortnight. A Keep Fit class and an Upholstery class are held each week in the village hall as are monthly Whist Drives and W.I. meetings. There is an annual Harvest Supper and an annual Village Quiz. Two ladies darts teams, two gents darts teams, a skittles team and a pool team are based at the Willow Tree public house in the village.
